com.guardtime.ksi.util

Class BaseX

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guardtime.ksi.util.BaseX

  • public class BaseX
extends Object
    A generic implementation base for the RFC 4648 base-X encoders/decoders.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BaseX(String alphabet, boolean caseSensitive, char padding)
      Constructs an encoder/decoder using the given characters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] decode(String in)
      Decodes the given base-X string into bytes, silently ignoring any non-base-X characters.
      StringBuffer encode(byte[] in, int off, int len, String sep, int freq)
      Encodes the given bytes into a base-X string, optionally inserting a separator into the result with given frequency.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseX

        public BaseX(String alphabet,
             boolean caseSensitive,
             char padding)
        Constructs an encoder/decoder using the given characters.
        Parameters:
        alphabet - the encoding alphabet: the characters to use in the encoded form. The length of this string must be an exact power of 2 and the characters must be distinct.
        caseSensitive - if true, both the encoder and decoder are case-sensitive; if false, the encoder always produces exactly the characters in alphabet, but decoder accepts both upper- and lower-case forms as equal.
        padding - the padding character used to even out the length of the encoded output. This must not appear in the encoding alphabet.

    • Method Detail

      • encode

        public final StringBuffer encode(byte[] in,
                                 int off,
                                 int len,
                                 String sep,
                                 int freq)
        Encodes the given bytes into a base-X string, optionally inserting a separator into the result with given frequency.
        Parameters:
        in - an array containing the bytes to encode.
        off - the start offset of the data within in.
        len - the number of bytes to encode.
        sep - if sep is not null and freq is positive, the sep is inserted into the result between blocks of freq normal characters.
        freq - if sep is not null and freq is positive, the sep is inserted into the result between blocks of freq normal characters.
        Returns:
        a newly allocated buffer containing the encoded data.

      • decode

        public final byte[] decode(String in)
        Decodes the given base-X string into bytes, silently ignoring any non-base-X characters.
        Parameters:
        in - the string to decode.
        Returns:
        the decoded bytes.
